definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Customs house's building and electronic waterfall clock also is quite new DuiJing.
sentences.chinese: 海关大楼与电子瀑布钟也是颇有新意的对景。

sentences.english: He called the new building unoriginal and said that it merely aped the classical traditions.
sentences.chinese: 他说这幢新建筑缺乏新意，只是仿效古典传统而已。

sentences.english: To avoid monotony, we must always find something fresh, new.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免千篇一律，我们必须发掘新意。

sentences.english: This is not only because of the iron law of waning novelty.
sentences.chinese: 这不仅仅是因为新意必将逐渐消退的铁则。

sentences.english: Fred’s jokes are always so corny.
sentences.chinese: 弗雷德的笑话总是如此毫无新意。

sentences.english: One says sort of news because of the timid way this development has been presented.
sentences.chinese: 说是几分新意，是因为这个发展态势是羞答答的。

sentences.english: Freds jokes are always so corny.
sentences.chinese: 弗雷德的笑话总是如此毫无新意。

sentences.english: The Bodyguard" is a fairly bog -standard thriller."
sentences.chinese: 《保镖》是一部毫无新意的惊险电影。

sentences.english: The new hotel VI template creative design ideas, so that the brand more innovative.
sentences.chinese: 酒店VI模板全新的创意设计思路，让品牌更有新意。

sentences.english: The opposition ridicules the government’s policies, saying they are offering nothing new.
sentences.chinese: 反对党嘲笑政府的政策毫无新意。

sentences.english: Another new edition to the ESPN Mandarin service, Simone also takes on bowling as well as cycling .
sentences.chinese: 康小玲亦为我们的保龄球及自行车项目带来了新意。

sentences.english: Confrontation with America did not disappear but took on a new meaning.
sentences.chinese: 与美国的对峙并未消失而是呈现出一种新意。

sentences.english: Fred's jokes are always so corny.
sentences.chinese: 福莱德的笑话总是了无新意。

sentences.english: It's so special and so unique.
And then in that environment, you're trying to be creative as well.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在这种环境下，你要想方设法弄出点新意。

definition: to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
qualities that make sth worth seeing (or reading)
lit. new wine in old bottles; fig. new concepts in an old framework/(loan idiom from Matthew 9:17, but fig. meaning is opposite)
thousand articles, same rule (idiom); stereotyped and repetitive/once you've seen one, you've seen them all
